title: Arian Foster sends wave of tweets on race, class after DOJ decision
text:
NFL February 23, 2017 7:08pm EST February 23, 2017 7:08pm EST American Football, News, English, Arian Foster, NFL, Miami Dolphins, Houston Texans Former NFL star Arian Foster is staying busy in retirement, sending out a series of tweets Thursday on race, class and other social issues. Arian Foster (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:08 p.m. ET 
Updated at 7:08 p.m. ET 
Anyone wondering how Arian Foster is spending his retirement, we can at least report how he spent a big chunk of time Thursday evening â€” tweeting out messages on race, crime, class and other social justice issues. 
The Twitter rush started late afternoon, after news broke that the U.S. Department of Justice ordered the continued use of private prisons, rescinding an order by officials under the previous administration of former president Barack Obama. 
"Wow. Prison labor on the horizon," Foster tweeted to his more than 595 thousand followers. wow. prison labor on the horizon. https://t.co/l1ScQJINOw 
Amid feedback from other Twitter users, Foster continued with some interesting thoughts on race, class, crime and other social issues dominating the political discussion in America today. yikes. you do realize prison labor is a euphemism for slavery? https://t.co/LGz6Zvs35r
